qas.question: What was the labor draft called?
Who helped build infrastructure around the lake?
What was the main problem with being so close to the lake?
What was a negative of regulating the lake's water height?

answers.text: changed the habitat for fish and birds

qas.question: How many Indians helped build the infrastructure?

context: The city grew as the population did, coming up against the lake's waters. As the depth of the lake water fluctuated, Mexico City was subject to periodic <a2_0>flooding<a2_0/>. A major labor draft, <a0_0>the desagüe<a0_0/>, compelled <a4_0>thousands<a4_0/> of <a1_0>Indians<a1_0/> over the colonial period to work on infrastructure to prevent flooding. Floods were not only an inconvenience but also a health hazard, since during flood periods human waste polluted the city's streets. By draining the area, the mosquito population dropped as did the frequency of the diseases they spread. However, draining the wetlands also <a3_0>changed the habitat for fish and birds<a3_0/> and the areas accessible for Indian cultivation close to the capital.
